poem:
**Whispers in the Temple**

The gods of finance mutter
over the altar of coin,
whittling down the brittle edge
of what we owe. 

In the shadow of walls,
households exhale,
briefly.
We who plow the fields 
hear the distant echo,
wonder how long
this respite will endure,
before the fields thirst again.
